title: UK PM Starmer reshuffles embattled Labour government after deputy's resignation
subhead: Amid a deepening crisis barely a year after Labour's return to power, the popular deputy prime minister, Angela Rayner, was forced to resign. David Lammy, the foreign secretary, has replaced her, with Yvette Cooper taking over his role.

title: At least 425 arrested at London protest supporting banned group Palestine Action
Sabalenka defeats Anisimova to retain US Open crown: 'I'm speechless right now'
'Neoliberalism has fueled the rise of reactionary values'
subhead: The US's reinforced interventionism in business signals the emergence of 'post-neoliberal' capitalism, observes Le Monde's Marie Charrel in her column. This marks the state's return in the service of an authoritarian project that disregards redistribution and social justice.

title: Indie favorite Jarmusch beats Gaza war film for Venice top prize
subhead: 'Father Mother Sister Brother' is the first Jim Jarmusch film to compete at Venice. Jarmusch signaled his opposition to Israel's continued siege and bombardment of Gaza by wearing a badge saying 'Enough' at the Venice awards ceremony.

title: Demna's thread between streetwear and haute couture
subhead: 'Essence of a Style' (5/6). Appointed to the helm of some of the biggest fashion houses, six designers are set to command the industry's attention this season. We look back at what has defined their distinctive touch so far, before their trial by fire. In this chapter, the former artistic director of Balenciaga, who is now at Gucci.

title: Isabelle Adjani, the masterfully ambiguous Queen Margot
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (5/6). After four years of hesitation that gave the director Patrice Chéreau many sleepless nights, the actress finally agreed to act in this bloody adaptation of an Alexandre Dumas novel.

The meteoric rise and exploited fame of Jean Pormanove, French streamer who died on-air
subhead: Jean Pormanove, a 46-year-old streamer, died on August 18 while streaming live on the Kick platform. He launched his career by streaming the video game 'Fortnite,' but ultimately became the star of a humiliating spectacle.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the French economist explains that protecting the planet from climate change cannot be achieved without reducing inequality.
byline: Interview by Nabil Wakim and Cécile Cazenave
